Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`So if you suddenly gain over 50% of the hashrate, that doesn't change consensus at all? Thought that was the whole idea behind a 51% attack...`
you're conflating concepts
`So if you suddenly gain over 50% of the hashrate, that doesn't change consensus at all?`
If, as stated previously, that increase stays with the same 1 node then , no, that doesn't change consensus at all (not even the slightest bit). If this is consusing to you, then I suggest you look up what "consensus" is/means and how it works.
`Besides, I wasn't originally talking about consensus within a single blockchain, but consensus about which blockchain is the real or "best" one.`
Again, this is at best a skewed concept.
>Bitcoing is the best because Bitcoin is the best, even when it's not
leads to the inability for any other coin to ever be "the best".
 `It seems that the answer is whichever one has the highest hashrate`
Even to that end, other algos have different means of measurement. By that hashrate measurement alone concept, VRSC is 42x "better" than ZEC and has a difficulty 3307x harder than KMD, so everything in the equihash realm is shit and we should just all dump it all and bow to VRSC as our new god
